text:
If events A and B are mutually exclusive, then:
A. P(A|B) = P(A).
B. P(AB) = P(A) x P(B).
C. P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B).
At a charity ball, 800 names are put into a hat. Four of the names are identical.
On a random draw, what is the probability that one of these four names will be
drawn?
A. 0.004.
B. 0.005.
C. 0.010.
Among 900 taxpayers with incomes below $100,000, 35 were audited by the
IRS. The probability that a randomly chosen individual with an income below
$100,000 was audited is closest to:
A. 0.039.
B. 0.125.
C. 0.350.
Which of the following values cannot be the probability of an event?
A. 0.00.
B. 1.00.
C. 1.25.
